record.dc:title: 54BT20, 15BT20, Butler County, Kentucky. Annis Village. Fire Basin.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Feature 35, fire basin in Structure 10, 2' long, 1.6' in greatest width, more oval-shaped than is usual. Three quarters of the perimeter, side walls, are clearly defined by a hard red burned crust. The interior depth is 0.5'. On the bottom rests a rather thick deposit of ash, 0.35' in thickness. The ash is clear; above it to top of basin was a number of pottery fragments, flint chips, etc. View from northwest. See also photos 52, 53.
